snippet: A series of new security measures implemented after a car bombing killed more than 300 in July have been largely successful, though fears of attacks remain....
abstract: Iraqi authorities and United States military officials in Iraq express cautious optimism about efforts to neutralize threat of Islamic State members retaliating for assault on Mosul with car bombings in Baghdad.

byline.contributor: Ahmed Salah contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Falih Hassan from Erbil, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: A series of new security measures implemented after a car bombing killed more than 300 in July have been largely successful, though fears of attacks remain.

headline.main: Cautious Optimism Over Efforts to Combat ISIS in Baghdad
headline.print_headline: Cautious Optimism About Security in Baghdad, Though Fears of ISIS Remain

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
